# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if isempty(current_line)
                current_line = word
            else
                current_line *= " " * word
            end
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the last line
    return join(lines, '\n')
end

# Example:
text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function `wrap_string` takes a string and iterates over its words. It ensures that adding another word doesn't surpass the specified maximum `text_width`. When this limit would be exceeded, the current line is pushed to a list of lines, and a new line is begun with the current word. Finally, it joins all lines using a newline character and returns the wrapped text.
